description: Recharge Package - Simulates distributed areal recharge to the groundwater system

variables.name: COMMENT
variables.description: Optional comment lines at beginning of file.
variables.tooltip: Lines starting with '#' are treated as comments and ignored by MODFLOW.

variables.name: NRCHOP
variables.description: Recharge option code. 1=recharge to top layer only, 2=recharge to vertical column defined by IRCH, 3=recharge to highest active cell in each column.
variables.tooltip: 1=recharge always applied to layer 1. 2=recharge applied to layer specified by IRCH array. 3=recharge applied to highest active cell (most common for multi-layer models).

variables.name: IRCHCB
variables.description: Unit number for cell-by-cell recharge flow terms. 0=no output, >0=write to this unit.
variables.tooltip: If > 0, recharge flow terms saved to binary file for post-processing. If 0, no cell-by-cell output.

variables.name: INRECH
variables.description: Flag for reading recharge array. >=0=read new RECH array, <0=reuse previous RECH.
variables.tooltip: If >= 0, a new recharge array is read. If < 0, the recharge array from the previous stress period is reused.

variables.name: INIRCH
variables.description: Flag for reading recharge layer indicator. >=0=read new IRCH, <0=reuse previous IRCH. Only if NRCHOP=2.
variables.tooltip: If >= 0, a new IRCH layer indicator array is read. If < 0, reuse the previous array. Only read when NRCHOP=2.

variables.name: RECH
variables.description: Recharge flux rate (L/T) applied to each vertical column.
variables.tooltip: 2D array of recharge flux (length/time). Applied as a volumetric rate = RECH * DELR * DELC. Positive values add water to the model.

variables.name: IRCH
variables.description: Layer number to which recharge is applied for each vertical column (1-based).
variables.tooltip: 2D array specifying which layer receives recharge at each column location. Only read when NRCHOP=2.
